Class Tile

java.lang.Object
Tile
public class Tile extends Object
Represents a single tile on the game board in Plants vs. Zombies. Each tile can contain a plant, multiple zombies, projectiles, and sun collectibles. It manages the entities within its boundaries and facilitates their interactions.
Since:
2025-06-27

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile(int lane, int tile)
      Creates a new tile and initializes its contents and position.
      Parameters:
      lane - The lane number of the created tile.
      tile - The tile number (column) for the created tile.

  • Method Details

    • spawnZombie

      public void spawnZombie(int laneNo, int tileNo, Armor armor)
      Spawns a zombie on this tile if it is the farthest tile in a lane (the rightmost tile). Prints a message to the console indicating successful or failed spawn.
      Parameters:
      laneNo - The lane number for the zombie.
      tileNo - The tile number for the zombie.
      armor - The Armor type for the spawned zombie.

    • placePlant

      public boolean placePlant(Plant p)
      Places a plant on this tile if it is not already occupied.
      Parameters:
      p - The plant to be placed.
      Returns:
      true if the plant is successfully placed, false otherwise.

    • placeZombie

      public void placeZombie(Zombie z)
      Adds a zombie to this tile. Used for both spawning and moving zombies between tiles.
      Parameters:
      z - The zombie to be placed.

    • placeProjectile

      public void placeProjectile(Projectile p)
      Places a projectile into this tile's list of active projectiles.
      Parameters:
      p - The projectile to be placed.

    • removeZombie

      public void removeZombie(Zombie z)
      Removes a specific zombie from this tile.
      Parameters:
      z - The zombie to be removed.

    • removePlant

      public void removePlant()
      Removes the plant currently occupying this tile. Prints a message to the console indicating the plant was removed.

    • noZombies

      public int noZombies()
      Counts the number of zombies currently present on this tile.
      Returns:
      The number of zombies in the tile.

    • highestPosition

      public Zombie highestPosition()
      Returns the zombie with the "highest" (i.e., furthest left, closest to the house) position within this tile. This is useful for determining which zombie a plant should target first.
      Returns:
      The zombie with the highest position, or null if no zombies are present.

    • getZombies

      public ArrayList<Zombie> getZombies()
      Returns the list containing all zombies on this tile.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Zombie objects.

    • getProjectiles

      public ArrayList<Projectile> getProjectiles()
      Returns the list of projectiles currently on this tile.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Projectile objects.

    • addSun

      public void addSun(Sun sun)
      Adds a sun collectible to this tile's list of suns.
      Parameters:
      sun - The Sun object to be added.

    • hasZombie

      public boolean hasZombie()
      Checks if this tile has any zombies occupying it.
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one zombie, false otherwise.

    • getPlant

      public Plant getPlant()
      Returns the plant currently occupying this tile.
      Returns:
      The Plant object, or null if no plant is occupying the tile.

    • getTileLength

      public static int getTileLength()
      Returns the conceptual length of a single tile, used for game world measurements.
      Returns:
      The length of a tile.

    • getSunList

      public ArrayList<Sun> getSunList()
      Returns the list of sun collectibles currently on this tile.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Sun objects.

    • getLaneNo

      public int getLaneNo()
      Returns the lane index (row) of this tile.
      Returns:
      The lane number of the tile.

    • getTileNo

      public int getTileNo()
      Returns the tile index (column) of this tile.
      Returns:
      The tile number of the tile.
